original: Hoppa, Ernst Carl, kyrkoherde, kontraktsprost, Motala, f. 13/2/87 i Hogstad, ö-stergötl. 1., av kyrkoh. Ernst Reinhold Dankegott H. o. Hilda Charlotta Petersson. G. 13 m. Anna Stina Cecilia Björkman. Barn:: Margit o. Gunnar ff. 14, Ingrid 21. —-Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 06, teol. kand. i Upps. 10, prästv. 10. Res. t. Tyskl., Danm. o. Engl. 23-24. Domkyrkoadj, i Linköp. 11-13, tf. kyrkoh. i Skäll-viks s :n 13-19, kommin. där 19, tf. domkyrkokommin. i Linköp. 19-20, kommin. i Linköp. S:t Lars förs. 21-24, kyrkoh. i Motala sed. 24, prost i Aska kontr. sed. 31. Led. av riksd. andra kamm. sed. 37, led. av andra kamm. första tillf. utsk. 37, tillika ordf., ordf. i Motala stads o. s:ns skol-styr. o. barnav:nd sed 24, led. av stadsfullm. sed. 32, v. ordf. 45, led. av be-redn :utsk. 37-40, ordf. i kyrkofullm. sed. 33 o. i styr. f. Motala samsk. sed. 36, led. av Linköp. stiftsråd 46, ordf. i östergötl. 1. distr. av Sv:es kristna soc:dem. sed. 36. Skr.: betraktelser o. upps.
translated: Hoppa, Ernst Carl, clergyman, senior pastor, Motala, born on February 13th, 1887 in Hogstad, East Gothland, son of the vicar Ernst Reinhold Dankegott H. and Hilda Charlotta Petersson. Married on June 13th to Anna Stina Cecilia Björkman. Children: Margit and Gunnar born in 1914, Ingrid born in 1921. He passed his high school exam in Norrköping in 1906, earned a Bachelor's degree in theology from Uppsala University in 1910, and was ordained a priest in the same year. He traveled to Germany, Denmark, and England in 1923-24. He served as a cathedral assistant in Linköping from 1911-1913, Acting Vicar in Skällvik from 1913-1919, and Curate there from 1919. He was an Acting Assistant Pastor in Linköping Cathedral from 1919-1920, Curate in the S:t Lars Parish in Linköping from 1921-1924, Vicar in Motala from 1924 and Senior Pastor in Aska Deanery from 1931. He was a member of the Swedish Parliament's Second Chamber from 1937, a member of the First Committee of the Second Chamber in 1937, and Chairman of the Motala City School Board and Child Welfare Board since 1924. He was a member of the City Council from 1932, Vice-Chairman in 1945, a member of the Preparation Committee from 1937-1940, Chairman of the Church Council since 1933 and of the Motala Joint School Board since 1936. He was a member of the Linköping Diocesan Council in 1946, and Chairman of the East Gothland District of the Swedish Christian Social Democrats since 1936. He has written reflections and essays.
